source.class:
the declaration whose scope this instance represents the enclosing scope of this scope Abstract superclass for lazy scope objects, used when building factories for generic information repositories. The type parameter D represents the type of reflective object whose scope this class is representing.

To subclass this, all one needs to do is implement computeEnclosingScope and the subclass' constructor. Constructor. Takes a reflective object whose scope the newly constructed instance will represent. D - A generic declaration whose scope the newly constructed instance will represent Accessor for the receiver - the object whose scope this Scope object represents. The object whose scope this Scope object represents This method must be implemented by any concrete subclass. It must return the enclosing scope of this scope. If this scope is a top-level scope, an instance of DummyScope must be returned. The enclosing scope of this scope Accessor for the enclosing scope, which is computed lazily and cached. the enclosing scope Lookup a type variable in the scope, using its name. Returns null if no type variable with this name is declared in this scope or any of its surrounding scopes. name - the name of the type variable being looked up the requested type variable, if found
